channel.title: Comments on: Continuous Delivery Project – Deploy and Smoke Test
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.dc:creator: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.description: I included a deploy step so I could perform the automated tests against a dedicated environment. In a real production system, you could have people actively testing whatever version is in QA but still want your newest changes to go as far as they could (including automated tests). Automated tests also run slower, so you might have newer changes coming in through CI and be ready to run through another Automated tests session as soon as the current one finishes. If one of the steps is frequently bogged down, it should help ensure as little downtime as possible between that step finishing and the next set of changes being available to run the step again.
item.content:encoded: I included a deploy step so I could perform the automated tests against a dedicated environment. In a real production system, you could have people actively testing whatever version is in QA but still want your newest changes to go as far as they could (including automated tests). Automated tests also run slower, so you might have newer changes coming in through CI and be ready to run through another Automated tests session as soon as the current one finishes. If one of the steps is frequently bogged down, it should help ensure as little downtime as possible between that step finishing and the next set of changes being available to run the step again.

item.title: By: Sharon Wang
item.dc:creator: Sharon Wang
item.description: I have a question. Why does Automated Test Stage include Deploy process? What is difference between the deploy and QA deploy?
item.content:encoded: I have a question. Why does Automated Test Stage include Deploy process? What is difference between the deploy and QA deploy?

item.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.dc:creator: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.description:
I've added the script as a gist here: https://gist.github.com/tarwn/daea99600b2caead549b
If I were doing it again, I would have included this script in the test repository rather than an absolute path from the server.
item.content:encoded:
I’ve added the script as a gist here: https://gist.github.com/tarwn/daea99600b2caead549b

If I were doing it again, I would have included this script in the test repository rather than an absolute path from the server.

item.title: By: amaresh
item.dc:creator: amaresh
item.description:
Hi Eli,
Thanks for the great article. I am also using Jenkins for CI. As I was going your article I came across you mentioning about "Smoke Testing Script". Could you please share the script. Thanks again
Regards, Amar
item.content:encoded:

Regards,
Amar

item.title: By: sachin
item.dc:creator: sachin
item.description: I have an one ASP .net C# Web application and i wants to start the jenkins job remotely through the my .net web application so please guid me for the same , to start jenkins job remotely
